### Solution {.tabset}

#### R
1. evaluate pdf
```{r}
dunif(0.8, 0, 1)
dnorm(0.8, 2, 10)

```
2. sample from distributions and plot them
```{r}
xs <- runif(10000, 0, 1)
ys <- rnorm(10000, 2, 10)
```

```{r}
par(mfrow=c(1,2))                       # optional, arranges both plots together
hist(xs)
hist(ys)

```

3. sample from $Z$
```{r}
xs <- runif(10000, 0, 1)                # sample from X
zs <- sin(2*pi*xs) * sqrt(xs)           # transfrom samples

```

```{r}
hist(zs, breaks=75)
```

#### Julia
1. Evaluate pdf
```{julia, results = 'hide'}
using Distributions

X = Uniform(0,1)
Y = Normal(2, 10)
```
Use the function `pdf`(Probability Density Function)
```{julia}
pdf_X = pdf(X, 0.8)
pdf_Y = pdf(Y, 0.8)
```

2. Sample from distributions and plot them

```{julia, results = 'hide'}
X_s = rand(X, 10000)
Y_s = rand(Y, 10000)
```

```{julia, out.width = '80%'}
using Plots
p = [
  histogram(X_s, nbins = 20,
    labels=false,
    xlabel="X sample",
    ylabel="Frequency",
    title="Histogram of X_s"),
  histogram(Y_s, nbins = 20,
    labels=false,
    xlabel="Y sample",
    ylabel="Frequency",
    title="Histogram of Y_s")
];
plot(p...)
```

3. Sample from $Z$
```{julia, results = 'hide'}
Z_s = sin.(2*Ï€*X_s).*sqrt.(X_s) #the dot symbol means that the operation is done component by component
```

```{julia, out.width = '80%'}

```
